com.xtructure.xneat.evolution
Interface NEATSpeciationStrategy<D>

Type Parameters:
D - type of data used in NEATGenomes
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractNEATSpeciationStrategy, NEATSpeciationStrategyImpl
public interface NEATSpeciationStrategy<D>

The NEATSpeciationStrategy interface describes methods for partitioning a given Population into species.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

Method Summary
 NEATEvolutionFieldMap getEvolutionFieldMap()
          Returns the NEATEvolutionFieldMap used by this NEATSpeciationStrategy.
 void respeciate(Population<D> population)
          Respeciates the given population if the current speciation is not acceptable (e.g., too many/few species).
 void speciate(Population<D> population)
          Removes any previous speciation and determines a new partition of the given population.
 void speciateChildren(java.util.Set<Genome<D>> children, Population<D> population)
          Adds the given children the population, and to the most appropriate species in that population.
 

Method Detail

speciate

void speciate(Population<D> population)
Removes any previous speciation and determines a new partition of the given population.

Parameters:
population - the population to speciate

respeciate

void respeciate(Population<D> population)
Respeciates the given population if the current speciation is not acceptable (e.g., too many/few species).

Parameters:
population - the population to speciate

speciateChildren

void speciateChildren(java.util.Set<Genome<D>> children,
                      Population<D> population)
Adds the given children the population, and to the most appropriate species in that population.

Parameters:
children - the genomes to add to the population
population - the population to which the children are added

getEvolutionFieldMap

NEATEvolutionFieldMap getEvolutionFieldMap()
Returns the NEATEvolutionFieldMap used by this NEATSpeciationStrategy.

Returns:
the NEATEvolutionFieldMap used by this NEATSpeciationStrategy.
